title: Below the Spine: Gray Threads
description: Under the market’s clamor, a net of crawlspaces called the Gray Threads links a dozen secret caches. Night air here tastes like oil and old salt. Ilya asks Kael to descend and stop a shipment gone ugly: bell grenades lifted from the Embersalt Arsenal now sit in a smuggler’s crate, and a hotheaded runner plans to light a fuse under the Shellspire debate to make a point with a bang. Neris Bonehook, a Gray Sail captain with hands like fishhooks and a grudging respect for clean work, believes violence is bad for business and worse for orphans who sleep near blast walls. The Threads are narrow; one wrong step can turn a quarrel into a war. Kael must talk where he can and draw only when words run out of arrows.
objectives: Meet Ilya Salt-Kite at a ratline hatch behind the east end of the Spine Market.
Locate the crate of bell grenades marked with arsenal seals without triggering any traps.
Confront Neris Bonehook and negotiate a stand-down to prevent the use of grenades during the Shellspire debate.
Identify which arsenal comptroller’s mark is stamped on the crate manifest.
Turn the grenades over to a neutral party for safekeeping (Fathom Tongues or Tidemasons) without alerting Brinewarden patrols.

intro.speaker: Ilya Salt-Kite
intro.line: I owe you for more than one narrow rib, and I’d rather pay you with a quiet night than with blood later. There’s a crate down there that hums anger when you put your ear to the wood. If that anger gets loose during the debate, the Council will hear only ringing for a month and pass whatever law the loudest faction hands them.

intro.speaker: Kael
intro.line: We’ll cut the fuse before someone decides to measure truth in shrapnel. If the crate sings, I’ll make it forget the tune.

during.speaker: Neris Bonehook
during.line: You climb soft, Rimestrand. Most men rattle like rusty anchors down here. I don’t fancy scraping children off market walls either. But the Brinewardens beat a soup line last season, and some of mine want to answer with heat they understand. You bring me a better answer, and I’ll leash my angry dogs.

during.speaker: Kael
during.line: Here’s a better answer: a ledger page with a comptroller’s skim written in numbers even a Councilor can’t pretend not to read. You trade me the grenades for this page and a promise that I carry it where it hurts. Your dogs get a story where they were strong enough to leash themselves. That’s a pride that doesn’t turn on you.

during.speaker: Neris Bonehook
during.line: A leash you put on yourself is a rope you don’t choke on. Take the crate. If the Brinewardens ask where it went, tell them I learned arithmetic. That’ll scare them more than a bang.

completion.speaker: Tern Quietwake
completion.line: I will keep these bells in water that remembers silence. You bring trouble that used to have teeth and you hand it to me with the teeth wrapped in cloth. I can work with that. When the city rings tomorrow, it will be with a question, not an explosion.

completion.speaker: Kael
completion.line: If the comptroller wants his skim back, he’ll have to ask under fossil chandeliers where the stone listens better than men do. I’ll stand where you can hear me when I say his name.

items: Gray Thread Knot-Token (smuggler truce emblem reducing hostility underground)
favors: Neris Bonehook owes one clandestine escort across the flats during a dim-out
access: Safe passage through one Gray Thread route during Council nights
